As a result of adding the log output, I found that the connection is closed because `bytesTransferred` is 0 in the following part:
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/v2.3.2/pulsar-client-cpp/lib/ClientConnection.cc#L435-L436

At this time, `err` contains either of the following two messages:
```
sslv3 alert bad record mac
unspecified system error
```

The latter error message only occurs when boost version is 1.70.0 (latest). I think this is due to the following modification of boost:
https://github.com/boostorg/asio/commit/7a4f4cb90f995f95b333635fbdb08dc5380b0864

We are starting to get requests for support for additional "types" within existing connectors and need to come up with some sort of strategy. / solution for this.  For instance, we current have an HDFS Sink connector that accepts String input and a customer is requesting support for byte[] .  This would be a very easy sink to write, but the packaging and deployment is the challenge.

> I don't think #3249 is a breaking change. If I remembered correctly, prior to #3249, you had to specify port in service url in order to make it work. 

I just double checked on version 2.2.1 and the pulsar-admin client correctly uses 80 and 443 for http and https ports.
@lsroudi Did you do `mvn install` or `mvn package`? Install should work, `package` has trouble finding some of the dependencies otherwise

> This probably means that the weaving is not working as expected on this module.

That is correct, Lombok and AspectJ don't play nice together. This is why we cannot use Lombok in the `pulsar-zookeeper-utils` module. The warning here should be not a problem.

@annubiz We do support JDK 11, (even though the unit tests are not completely passing, mostly due to Mockito and Powermock issues), though we haven't started to check with JDK 12. 

It would be good to have a Jenkins pipeline with JDK 12 setup for 2.5 release

> But then, it invokes the method ProducerImpl::failPendingMessages(...) for dealing the message failure stuff. Definitely, it works, but not only on the message it already checked as we hoped, but just all the messages inside ProducerImpl::pendingMessagesQueue_.

The reason for erroring out all the messages in the queue after the 1st message times out is to give chance to the application to preserve ordering. 

If you're publishing m1, m2 and m3. If m2 times out, a consumer might see m1 followed by m3. By clearing the queue, application can decides to resend m2 & m3 in same order (or just failed both upstream operations). 

Another consideration, is that typically the timeout is set to a value which is order of magnitudes bigger than the normal publish latency (eg: 30sec vs 5millis). This means that when one message times out, it will be very likely that some bigger issue is involved and that most of the messages will anyway hit the timeout threshold.

In `AbstractZkLedgerManager`, the ZK event callback thread does the subsequent task without starting a different thread.
https://github.com/apache/bookkeeper/blob/release-4.9.2/bookkeeper-server/src/main/java/org/apache/bookkeeper/meta/AbstractZkLedgerManager.java#L441-L450

Is this similar to the part that caused the previous bug?
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3591/files#diff-e31620999c95d63a09c11ae894f943be

We also added role based function authentication and authorization.  Though there are currently no documentation written for them yet
@jerrypeng Can you provide some simple usage examples so that I can add them to the security section?

It seems that there is a possibility that the SSL socket will be corrupted if read and write from multiple threads are performed concurrently. Furthermore, a class named `strand` seems to be typically used to avoid this (Currently, `strand.wrap()` is deprecated and `bind_executor()` seems to be an alternative).
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18656919/boostasiossl-access-violation-on-multi-threaded-application

Is this issue related to the above?

@sijie @jiazhai @codelipenghui @merlimat you you take another look? I had to change the approach to strip the deleted schemas in getSchema, because a consumer _should_ be prevented from attaching with a schema if there is a producer currently producing without a schema.
